titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C17

availability.licence: Distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License

body.ab: <milestone spanTo="#c57-0002.07" unit="tei:head"/><lb n="c57-0002__main__1"/> Vol. II <lb n="c57-0002__main__2"/> Chap I<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0002__main__3"/> "It is with difficulty that I remember <lb n="c57-0002__main__4"/> the æra of my <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0002__main__d3e35"/>cr<del eID="c57-0002__main__d3e35"/> being. All the events of <lb n="c57-0002__main__5"/> that period appear confused & indistinct. <lb n="c57-0002__main__6"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0002__main__d3e42"/>I know only that I felt a strange<del eID="c57-0002__main__d3e42"/> A strange <lb n="c57-0002__main__7"/> sensation <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0002__main__d3e51"/>sea<del eID="c57-0002__main__d3e51"/> seized me <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0002__main__d3e54"/>and a it appeared<del eID="c57-0002__main__d3e54"/><lb n="c57-0002__main__8"/> I saw, felt heard and smelt at the same <lb n="c57-0002__main__9"/> time and it was indeed a long time be<lb n="c57-0002__main__10"/>fore I learned to distinguish between the <lb n="c57-0002__main__11"/><lb n="c57-0002__left_margin__1"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0002__left_margin__d3e76"/>various <del eID="c57-0002__left_margin__d3e76"/><del rend="unmarked" sID="c57-0002__main__d3e83"/><del eID="c57-0002__main__d3e83"/>operations of my various senses. By degrees <lb n="c57-0002__main__12"/> I remember a stronger light pressed upon <lb n="c57-0002__main__13"/> my nerves <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0002__main__d3e97"/>and<del eID="c57-0002__main__d3e97"/> so that I was obliged to close <lb n="c57-0002__main__14"/> my eyes. Darkness then came over me <lb n="c57-0002__main__15"/> and troubled me.– But hardly had I felt <lb n="c57-0002__main__16"/> this when (by opening my eyes as I now suppose) <lb n="c57-0002__main__17"/> the light poured in upon me again– I walked <lb n="c57-0002__main__18"/> and I believe descended; but presently I found <lb n="c57-0002__main__19"/> a great <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0002__main__d3e115"/>difference<del eID="c57-0002__main__d3e115"/>alteration in my sensations; before <lb n="c57-0002__main__20"/> dark opaque bodies had surrounded me,<lb n="c57-0002__main__21"/> impervious to my touch or sight – and I <lb n="c57-0002__main__22"/> now found that I could wander on at liberty <lb n="c57-0002__main__23"/> with no obstacles which I could not either <lb n="c57-0002__main__24"/> surmount or avoid– The light <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0002__main__d3e136"/>be<del eID="c57-0002__main__d3e136"/> became <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>more&<lb n="c57-0002__main__25"/> more opressive to me and the heat wearying <lb n="c57-0002__main__26"/> me as I walked I sought a place where I could <lb n="c57-0002__main__27"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0002.04" unit="tei:seg" xml:id="c57-0002.02"/>perceive<milestone spanTo="#c57-0002.05" unit="tei:seg" xml:id="c57-0002.03"/>recieve shade. This was the forest near Ingolstadt,<lb n="c57-0002__main__28"/> and here by the side of a brook I lay <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0002__main__d3e174"/>weary<del eID="c57-0002__main__d3e174"/><lb n="c57-0002__main__29"/> for some hours <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>resting from my fatigue untill I felt tormented by <lb n="c57-0002__main__30"/> hunger and thirst. This roused me from my nearly<lb n="c57-0003__main__1"/> dormant state and I ate some berries <lb n="c57-0003__main__2"/> which I found <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>hanging on the trees or lying on <lb n="c57-0003__main__3"/> the ground – I slaked my thirst by the <lb n="c57-0003__main__4"/> brook and then again lying down I was <lb n="c57-0003__main__5"/> overcome by sleep<mdel>–</mdel>; It was dark when I <lb n="c57-0003__main__6"/> awoke, I felt cold also and half frightened <lb n="c57-0003__main__7"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>as it were instinctively on <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0003__main__d3e250"/>seein<del eID="c57-0003__main__d3e250"/> finding myself so desolate. <lb n="c57-0003__main__8"/> Before I had quitted your appartment <lb n="c57-0003__main__9"/> on a sensation of cold I had covered my <lb n="c57-0003__main__10"/> self with some clothes, but these were <lb n="c57-0003__main__11"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0003__main__d3e265"/>not<del eID="c57-0003__main__d3e265"/>insufficient to secure me from the <lb n="c57-0003__main__12"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0003__main__d3e274"/>dw<del eID="c57-0003__main__d3e274"/> dews of night. I was a poor helpless <lb n="c57-0003__main__13"/> miserable wretch—I knew <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0003__main__d3e279"/>no<del eID="c57-0003__main__d3e279"/>& could <lb n="c57-0003__main__14"/> distinguish <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0003__main__d3e285"/>no<del eID="c57-0003__main__d3e285"/> nothing but <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0003__main__d3e290"/>felt<del eID="c57-0003__main__d3e290"/><metamark>^</metamark>feeling pain <lb n="c57-0003__main__15"/> invade me on all sides <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0003__main__d3e305"/>and<del eID="c57-0003__main__d3e305"/> I sat down <lb n="c57-0003__main__16"/> and wept.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0003__main__17"/> Soon a gentle light stole over the <lb n="c57-0003__main__18"/> heavens and gave me a sensation of pleasure <lb n="c57-0003__main__19"/> I started up, and beheld a radiant form <lb n="c57-0003__main__20"/> rise <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0003__main__d3e321"/>am<del eID="c57-0003__main__d3e321"/> from among the trees. I gazed with <lb n="c57-0003__main__21"/> a kind of wonder – It moved slowly; but <lb n="c57-0003__main__22"/> it enlightened my path, and I again <lb n="c57-0003__main__23"/> went out in search of berries. I was still <lb n="c57-0003__main__24"/> cold when <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0003__main__d3e333"/>on the ground<del eID="c57-0003__main__d3e333"/> under one of the <lb n="c57-0003__main__25"/> trees I found a huge cloak with which I– <lb n="c57-0003__main__26"/> covered myself, and sat down on the ground. <lb n="c57-0003__main__27"/> No distinct ideas occupied my mind all was <lb n="c57-0003__main__28"/> confused <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0003__main__d3e345"/>and<del eID="c57-0003__main__d3e345"/> I felt the light, and hunger <lb n="c57-0003__main__29"/> and thirst and darkness; innumerable <lb n="c57-0003__main__30"/> sounds rung in my ears and on all sides <lb n="c57-0003__main__31"/> various scents saluted me; the only object <lb n="c57-0003__main__32"/> that I could distinguish was the bright<lb n="c57-0004__main__1"/> moon and I fixed my eyes <mdel>i</mdel>on <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e380"/>th<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e380"/> that with <lb n="c57-0004__main__2"/> pleasure. Several changes of day and night <lb n="c57-0004__main__3"/> passed and the orb of night had greatly <lb n="c57-0004__main__4"/> lessened when I began to distinguish my <lb n="c57-0004__main__5"/> sensations <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>from each other–. I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e406"/>first saw<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e406"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e411"/>dis<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e411"/> gradually saw plainly the clear stream <lb n="c57-0004__main__6"/> that supplied me with drink and the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e419"/>gre<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e419"/><lb n="c57-0004__main__7"/> trees that <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e429"/>covered<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e429"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>shaded me with their foliage. <lb n="c57-0004__main__8"/> I was delighted when I first discovered <lb n="c57-0004__main__9"/> that a pleasant sound <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e448"/>that<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e448"/>which often <lb n="c57-0004__main__10"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e458"/>delighte<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e458"/> saluted my ears proceeded <lb n="c57-0004__main__11"/> from the throats of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e463"/>son<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e463"/> the little <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e468"/>anih<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e468"/>winged<lb n="c57-0004__main__12"/>a<mdel>m</mdel>nimals who often intercepted the light<lb n="c57-0004__main__13"/> from my eyes. I began also to see <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e493"/>an<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e493"/><lb n="c57-0004__main__14"/> with <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e499"/>forms<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e499"/> greater accuracy the forms <lb n="c57-0004__main__15"/> that surrounded me and to perceive <lb n="c57-0004__main__16"/> the boundaries of the radiant light which <lb n="c57-0004__main__17"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e508"/>overspeaed my dwelling<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e508"/> canopied me.–some<lb n="c57-0004__main__18"/>times I tried to imitate the pleasant songs of <lb n="c57-0004__main__19"/> the birds but was unable— Sometimes I <lb n="c57-0004__main__20"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e525"/>also<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e525"/> wished to express my sensations in <lb n="c57-0004__main__21"/> my own mode but the uncouth and innarticu<lb n="c57-0004__main__22"/>late sound which broke from me <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e547"/>which<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e547"/> frightened <lb n="c57-0004__main__23"/> me into silence again.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0004__main__24"/> The moon had dissapeared from the night, &<lb n="c57-0004__main__25"/> again with a lessened form it shewed itself <lb n="c57-0004__main__26"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e561"/>again<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e561"/> while I still remained in the forest. <lb n="c57-0004__main__27"/> My <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e568"/>ideas<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e568"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>sensations were by this time become distinct <lb n="c57-0004__main__28"/>&<mdel/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>my mind received every day aditional <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0004__main__d3e604"/>ones<del eID="c57-0004__main__d3e604"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>ideas. My eyes <lb n="c57-0004__main__29"/> became accustomed to the light and to <lb n="c57-0004__main__30"/> perceive objects in their right forms; I distin<lb n="c57-0005__main__1"/><lb n="c57-0005__left_margin__1"/>guished the<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e645"/>insect<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e645"/> insect from the herb, and by de<lb n="c57-0005__main__2"/>grees one herb from <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e655"/>a<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e655"/> another – I found <lb n="c57-0005__main__3"/> that the sparrow uttered none but harsh <lb n="c57-0005__main__4"/> notes <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e664"/>and<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e664"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e667"/>but<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e667"/>whilst<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e680"/>that<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e680"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>those of the blackbird were sweet <lb n="c57-0005__main__5"/> and enticing. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e695"/>I had le<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e695"/> one day when I was <lb n="c57-0005__main__6"/> oppressed by cold I found a fire that <lb n="c57-0005__main__7"/> had been left by some wandering beg<lb n="c57-0005__main__8"/>gars and was over come with delight<mdel>.</mdel><metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c57-0005.02">X</metamark><lb n="c57-0005__left_margin__1"/><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark><lb n="c57-0005__left_margin__2"/> at the warmth <lb n="c57-0005__left_margin__3"/> which I ex- <lb n="c57-0005__left_margin__4"/> perienced from <lb n="c57-0005__left_margin__5"/> it.<lb n="c57-0005__main__9"/> In my joy I thrust my hand into the <lb n="c57-0005__main__10"/> live embers but quickly drew it away with a cry<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e753"/>in<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e753"/><lb n="c57-0005__left_margin__1"/>of <lb n="c57-0005__main__11"/>pain– How strange, I thought, that the <lb n="c57-0005__main__12"/> same cause should at once produce <lb n="c57-0005__main__13"/> such <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e775"/>delicious and such<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e775"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e778"/>u<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e778"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e784"/>opp<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e784"/> opposite <lb n="c57-0005__main__14"/> effects –I examined the materials of the <lb n="c57-0005__main__15"/> fire, & to my joy found it to be wood – <lb n="c57-0005__main__16"/> I quickly collected some branches but <lb n="c57-0005__main__17"/> they were wet and would not burn. <lb n="c57-0005__main__18"/> I was pained at this and sat still <lb n="c57-0005__main__19"/> watching the o<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e800"/>p<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e800"/>peration of the fire. <lb n="c57-0005__main__20"/> The wet wood I had placed near the heat <lb n="c57-0005__main__21"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e810"/>became dy dry<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e810"/>dried, and itself <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e817"/>became<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e817"/> became <lb n="c57-0005__main__22"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e824"/>hot<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e824"/><lb n="c57-0005__left_margin__1"/>inflamed. I reflected on this, and by touching <lb n="c57-0005__main__23"/> the various branches I discovered the cause <lb n="c57-0005__main__24"/> and busied myself in collecti<mdel>on</mdel>ng a great <lb n="c57-0005__main__25"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e856"/>deal<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e856"/>quantity of wood that I might dry it and <lb n="c57-0005__main__26"/> have a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e865"/>pel<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e865"/> plentiful supply oof fire. When night <lb n="c57-0005__main__27"/> came on and <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>brought with it sleep, I was in the greatest <lb n="c57-0005__main__28"/> fear lest my fire should be extinguished <lb n="c57-0005__main__29"/> I covered it carefully with <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e894"/>try<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e894"/> dry wood <lb n="c57-0005__main__30"/> and leaves & then placed upon that wet <lb n="c57-0005__main__31"/> branches and then spreading my cloak I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0005__main__d3e901"/>la<del eID="c57-0005__main__d3e901"/><lb n="c57-0006__main__1"/> on the ground <mdel>I</mdel>& sunk into sleep. I was morning <lb n="c57-0006__main__2"/> when I It was morning when I awoke & my <lb n="c57-0006__main__3"/> first care was to visit the fire –I uncovered <lb n="c57-0006__main__4"/> it and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0006__main__d3e934"/>th<del eID="c57-0006__main__d3e934"/> a gentle breeze quickly fanned it <lb n="c57-0006__main__5"/> into a flame I observed this also and contri<lb n="c57-0006__main__6"/>ved a fan of branches which roused the <lb n="c57-0006__main__7"/> embers when thy were nearly extinguished. <lb n="c57-0006__main__8"/> When night again came I found with plea<lb n="c57-0006__main__9"/>sure that the fire gave light as well <lb n="c57-0006__main__10"/> as heat <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0006__main__d3e959"/>and I often<del eID="c57-0006__main__d3e959"/> and the discovery of this <lb n="c57-0006__main__11"/> element was useful to me also in my food– <lb n="c57-0006__main__12"/> for I found some of offals that the travel<lb n="c57-0006__main__13"/>lers had left had been roasted and tasted <lb n="c57-0006__main__14"/> much more savoury than the berries <lb n="c57-0006__main__15"/> I gathered; I tried therefore to dress my food <lb n="c57-0006__main__16"/> in the same manner, placing them <lb n="c57-0006__main__17"/> on the live embers– I found that the <lb n="c57-0006__main__18"/> berries were spoiled by this o<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0006__main__d3e984"/>p<del eID="c57-0006__main__d3e984"/>peration <lb n="c57-0006__main__19"/> and the nuts much improved. Food <lb n="c57-0006__main__20"/> however became very scarce and I often <lb n="c57-0006__main__21"/> spent a day searching in vain for a <lb n="c57-0006__main__22"/> few acorns to assuage the pangs of hunger. <lb n="c57-0006__main__23"/> When I found this resolved to quit the place <lb n="c57-0006__main__24"/> which I had hitherto inhabited & to seek for <lb n="c57-0006__main__25"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0006__main__d3e1004"/>a place<del eID="c57-0006__main__d3e1004"/>one where the few wants I expe<lb n="c57-0006__main__26"/>rienced would be more easily satisfied. <lb n="c57-0006__main__27"/> In this emigration I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0006__main__d3e1022"/>extremely<del eID="c57-0006__main__d3e1022"/>exceedingly lamented the <lb n="c57-0006__main__28"/> loss of my fire–I had obtained it <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0006__main__d3e1031"/>by<del eID="c57-0006__main__d3e1031"/> by strange <lb n="c57-0006__main__29"/> means and knew not how to reproduce it. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0006__main__d3e1043"/>by myself<del eID="c57-0006__main__d3e1043"/><lb n="c57-0006__main__30"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0006__main__d3e1050"/>This<del eID="c57-0006__main__d3e1050"/><lb n="c57-0006__left_margin__1"/>this deficiency obtained my serious consideration for <lb n="c57-0006__main__31"/> several hours but I was obliged to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0006__main__d3e1066"/>leave it<del eID="c57-0006__main__d3e1066"/><lb n="c57-0007__main__1"/><lb n="c57-0007__left_margin__1"/> relinquish all <lb n="c57-0007__left_margin__2"/> attempts to <lb n="c57-0007__left_margin__3"/> supply it, and wrapp<mdel/>ing myself up in my cloak <lb n="c57-0007__main__2"/> I struck across the wood towards the <lb n="c57-0007__main__3"/> setting sun – I passed three days in these <lb n="c57-0007__main__4"/> rambles and at length discovered the <lb n="c57-0007__main__5"/> open country – A great fall of snow had <lb n="c57-0007__main__6"/> taken place the night before and the <lb n="c57-0007__main__7"/> fields were of one uni<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1119"/>n<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1119"/>form white the <lb n="c57-0007__main__8"/> appearrance was disconsolate and I <lb n="c57-0007__main__9"/> found my feet chilled by the cold <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1127"/>dab<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1127"/><lb n="c57-0007__main__10"/> damp <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>substance that covered the ground – It was about seven in <lb n="c57-0007__main__11"/> the morning and I longed to obtain food <lb n="c57-0007__main__12"/> and shelter. At length I perceived <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1149"/>in<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1149"/> a <lb n="c57-0007__main__13"/> small hut which had <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1154"/>b<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1154"/> doubtless been <lb n="c57-0007__main__14"/> built for the convenience of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1162"/>the<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1162"/><lb n="c57-0007__main__15"/> some shepheard. This was a new sight <lb n="c57-0007__main__16"/> to me and I examined the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1173"/>stu<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1173"/>struc<lb n="c57-0007__main__17"/>ture of it with great curiosity. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1183"/>and<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1183"/><lb n="c57-0007__main__18"/> finding the door open I entered. An old <lb n="c57-0007__main__19"/> man sat <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1190"/>it<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1190"/> in it, near a fire <mdel>on</mdel>over<mdel/><lb n="c57-0007__main__20"/> which he was preparing his breakfast <lb n="c57-0007__main__21"/> he turned <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1213"/>of<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1213"/> on hearing a noise <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1216"/>&<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1216"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1219"/>on<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1219"/><lb n="c57-0007__main__22"/><lb n="c57-0007__left_margin__1"/>and perceiving me shrieked loudly and quiting <lb n="c57-0007__main__23"/> the hut ran across the fields with <lb n="c57-0007__main__24"/> a speed <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1242"/>little<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1242"/> of which his debilitated form <lb n="c57-0007__main__25"/> hardly appeared capable.<mdel>of</mdel> His flight <lb n="c57-0007__main__26"/> somewhat surprised me – but I was <lb n="c57-0007__main__27"/> inchanted with the appearance of the <lb n="c57-0007__main__28"/> hut. Here the snow and rain could not <lb n="c57-0007__main__29"/> penetrate – the ground was dry and wind <lb n="c57-0007__main__30"/> expelled and it <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1274"/>appeared<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1274"/>presented to me then <lb n="c57-0007__main__31"/> as <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0007__main__d3e1283"/>heavenly and divine<del eID="c57-0007__main__d3e1283"/> exquisite &di<lb n="c57-0008__main__1"/>vine a retreat as Pandemonium appeared <lb n="c57-0008__main__2"/> to the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1303"/>tr<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1303"/> dominions of Hell<del rend="unmarked" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1309"/>.<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1309"/> after thier suffocation in the <lb n="c57-0008__left_margin__1"/> lake of <lb n="c57-0008__left_margin__2"/> fire. I greedily <lb n="c57-0008__main__3"/> devoured the rem<mdel>m</mdel>nants of the shepherds <lb n="c57-0008__main__4"/> breakfast which consisted of bread, cheese, <lb n="c57-0008__main__5"/> milk & rhenish wine; the latter of which <lb n="c57-0008__main__6"/> however I did not like. Then overcome <lb n="c57-0008__main__7"/> by fatigue I lay down among some straw <lb n="c57-0008__main__8"/>& fell asleep.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0008__main__9"/> It was noon when I awoke and allured <lb n="c57-0008__main__10"/> by the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1358"/>warth<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1358"/> warmth of the sun I deter<lb n="c57-0008__main__11"/>mined to recommence my travels–&<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1369"/>wrapping<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1369"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1372"/>dep<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1372"/><lb n="c57-0008__left_margin__1"/>depositing<lb n="c57-0008__main__12"/> the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1394"/>rest<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1394"/>remains of the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1401"/>herds bre<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1401"/> peasants break<lb n="c57-0008__main__13"/>fast in a wallet I found, I proceeded <lb n="c57-0008__main__14"/> across the fields for several hours, untill <lb n="c57-0008__main__15"/> at sunset I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1417"/>came to<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1417"/>arrived at a village. How mira<lb n="c57-0008__main__16"/>culous did this appear. The huts the neater <lb n="c57-0008__main__17"/> cottages & stat<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>elier houses engaged my <lb n="c57-0008__main__18"/> admiration by turns– The vegetables in the <lb n="c57-0008__main__19"/> gardens<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1452"/>allured me<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1452"/> and the milk and <lb n="c57-0008__main__20"/> cheese that I saw placed at <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1458"/>s<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1458"/> the windows <lb n="c57-0008__main__21"/> of some of the cottages<mdel>—</mdel>allured me— One of the best of <lb n="c57-0008__main__22"/> these I entered– but I had hardly placed <lb n="c57-0008__main__23"/> my foot <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1479"/>inside<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1479"/>within the door before the <lb n="c57-0008__main__24"/> children shrieked and one of the child<lb n="c57-0008__main__25"/>ren women fainted, the village was roused <lb n="c57-0008__main__26"/> some fled,—some attacked me untill <lb n="c57-0008__main__27"/> grievously bruised by <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1505"/>sticks<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1505"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>stones and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0008__main__d3e1518"/>all<del eID="c57-0008__main__d3e1518"/><lb n="c57-0008__main__28"/> many other kinds of missile weapon I<lb n="c57-0009__main__1"/> escaped to the open country and fear <lb n="c57-0009__main__2"/> fully took refuge in a low <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0009__main__d3e1537"/>hut<del eID="c57-0009__main__d3e1537"/>hovel –quite <lb n="c57-0009__main__3"/> bare and making a wretched appearance <lb n="c57-0009__main__4"/> after the pal<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0009__main__d3e1549"/>l<del eID="c57-0009__main__d3e1549"/>aces I had beheld in the <lb n="c57-0009__main__5"/> village.– This <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0009__main__d3e1556"/>hut<del eID="c57-0009__main__d3e1556"/>hovel however adjoined a <lb n="c57-0009__main__6"/> cottage of a neat & pleasant appearance, <lb n="c57-0009__main__7"/> but after my late <metamark>^</metamark>dearly bought experience <lb n="c57-0009__main__8"/> I dared not enter it. My place of refuge<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c57-0009.04">X</metamark><lb n="c57-0009__main__9"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0009__main__d3e1592"/>was the tool house and had not been<del eID="c57-0009__main__d3e1592"/><lb n="c57-0009__main__10"/>was not used <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0009__main__d3e1606"/>for<del eID="c57-0009__main__d3e1606"/> by the inhabitants of the ad<lb n="c57-0009__main__11"/>joining dwelling and was entirely shut <lb n="c57-0009__main__12"/> out from view by a pigstye on one <lb n="c57-0009__main__13"/> side and a dunghill & small <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0009__main__d3e1620"/>s<del eID="c57-0009__main__d3e1620"/>pool <lb n="c57-0009__main__14"/> on <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0009__main__d3e1625"/>the<del eID="c57-0009__main__d3e1625"/> another – the two others were <lb n="c57-0009__main__15"/> formed by the wall of the cottage. Here <lb n="c57-0009__main__16"/>then I retreated and lay down happy to have <lb n="c57-0009__main__17"/> found a shelter from the inclemency <lb n="c57-0009__main__18"/> of the season & still more from the <lb n="c57-0009__main__19"/> barbarity of man <lb n="c57-0009__main__20"/><metamark function="separate">___________________________</metamark><lb n="c57-0009__main__21"/> was constructed of wood, <mdel>&</mdel>but so low that <lb n="c57-0009__main__22"/> I could with difficulty sit upright in <lb n="c57-0009__main__23"/> it. <del rend="strikethrough" cottage but it was dry <lb n="c57-0009__main__26"/> and although the wind entered by <lb n="c57-0009__main__27"/> innumerable chinks I found it an <lb n="c57-0009__main__28"/> agreable assylum from n="c57-0010__main__4"/> adjacent cottage and discover if I could <lb n="c57-0010__main__5"/> remain in the kennel that I had found. <lb n="c57-0010__main__6"/> It was situated <mdel>at</mdel><metamark n="c57-0010__main__13"/> that I could move the<mdel>n</mdel>m on an occasion <lb n="c57-0010__main__14"/> to pass out; all the light I enjoyed came <lb n="c57-0010__main__15"/> through the stye and that was suffi <lb n="c57-0010__main__16"/> cient for me.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0010__main__17"/> Having thus arranged my dwelling &<lb n="c57-0010__main__18"/><del rend="strikethrough" eID="c57-0011__main__d3e2040"/><mdel>b</mdel>Being thus provided <lb n="c57-0011__main__7"/> I determined to reside in this hovel <lb n="c57-0011__main__8"/> untill <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0011__main__d3e2056"/>o<del eID="c57-0011__main__d3e2056"/> something should occur which <lb n="c57-0011__main__9"/> might alter my determination. It <lb n="c57-0011__main__10"/> was indeed a paradise compared to <lb n="c57-0011__main__11"/> the blea<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0011__main__d3e2066"/>c<del eID="c57-0011__main__d3e2066"/>k forest, my former residence, <lb n="c57-0011__main__12"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0011__main__d3e2071"/>and<del eID="c57-0011__main__d3e2071"/> the<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0011__main__d3e2075"/>ir<del eID="c57-0011__main__d3e2075"/> rain dropping <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0011__main__d3e2080"/>leaves<del eID="c57-0011__main__d3e2080"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>branches <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>& the dank earth. I ate <lb n="c57-0011__main__13"/> my breakfast with pleasure and was <lb n="c57-0011__main__14"/> about to remove a plank to procure <lb n="c57-0011__main__15"/> myself a little water when I heard <lb n="c57-0011__main__16"/> a step and looking through a small <lb n="c57-0011__main__17"/> chink a beheld a young creature <lb n="c57-0011__main__18"/> with a pail on her head passing <lb n="c57-0011__main__19"/> before my hovel. The girl was youn<mdel/>g<lb n="c57-0011__main__20"/> and of gentle demænour unlike what <lb n="c57-0011__main__21"/> I have since found Cottagers and farm <lb n="c57-0011__main__22"/> house servants to be – Yet she was mean <lb n="c57-0011__main__23"/> ly dressed – a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0011__main__d3e2138"/>blue<del eID="c57-0011__main__d3e2138"/> coarse <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>blue petticoat and a <lb n="c57-0011__main__24"/><lb n="c57-0011__left_margin__1"/>linen jacket being her only garb <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0011__main__d3e2166"/>on<del eID="c57-0011__main__d3e2166"/> her fair hair <lb n="c57-0011__main__25"/> was plaited but not adorned; she looked patient <lb n="c57-0011__main__26"/> yet sad. She passed <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0011__main__d3e2173"/>aw<del eID="c57-0011__main__d3e2173"/> away but in a quarter <lb n="c57-0011__main__27"/> of an hour returned, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0011__main__d3e2179"/>be<del eID="c57-0011__main__d3e2179"/> bearing the pail which <lb n="c57-0011__main__28"/> was now partly filled with milk. As she walked <lb n="c57-0011__main__29"/> along seemingly incommoded by the burthen<lb n="c57-0012__main__1"/> a young man met her whose countenance <lb n="c57-0012__main__2"/> expressed a deeper desponc<mdel/>ens<del rend="overwritten" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2211"/>des<del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2211"/>cesly; <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2218"/>than her<del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2218"/><lb n="c57-0012__main__3"/> uttering a few <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2226"/>words<del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2226"/>sounds with <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2233"/>ain<del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2233"/> an air of <lb n="c57-0012__main__4"/> melancholy he took the pail from her head <lb n="c57-0012__main__5"/> and bore it into the cottage himself. She <lb n="c57-0012__main__6"/> followed <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2243"/>wiping<del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2243"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2246"/>dry my her tears whi<del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2246"/>, and they <lb n="c57-0012__main__7"/> diasppeared – Presently I saw the young man <lb n="c57-0012__main__8"/> again with some tools in his hand cross the <lb n="c57-0012__main__9"/> field opposite the cottage and the girl was <lb n="c57-0012__main__10"/> also busied someti<mdel>n</mdel>mes in <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2267"/>and som<del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2267"/> the cottage <lb n="c57-0012__main__11"/> and sometimes in the yard where she fe<mdel>t</mdel>d<lb n="c57-0012__main__12"/> some <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2283"/>ck<del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2283"/> chickens. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2287"/>and after some hours <del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2287"/>While <lb n="c57-0012__main__13"/> I examined my dwelling I discovered that part <lb n="c57-0012__main__14"/> of the cottage window had formerly occupied <lb n="c57-0012__main__15"/> a corner of it <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2296"/>pu<del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2296"/> but the panes had <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0012__main__d3e2299"/>n<del eID="c57-0012__main__d3e2299"/> been <lb n="c57-0012__main__16"/> filled up with wood. sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2502"/>whec<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2502"/> wretch who had never beheld aught <lb n="c57-0013__main__3"/> beautiful before. <del rend="strikethrough" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2529"/>the<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2529"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2532"/>more<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2532"/> aged <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2535"/>inhabit<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2535"/> cottager won my reverence <lb n="c57-0013__main__5"/> while <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the gentle manners of the girl enticed <lb n="c57-0013__main__6"/> my love. He played a sweet mournful <lb n="c57-0013__main__7"/> air which I percieved drew tears from <lb n="c57-0013__main__8"/> the eyes of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2563"/>the gen amiable gir<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2563"/><mdel>l</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>his <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2577"/>you<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2577"/> amiable companion<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2582"/>till her<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2582"/><lb n="c57-0013__main__9"/><lb n="c57-0013__left_margin__1"/>of which the old man took <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>no notice <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2610"/>of<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2610"/> it untill <lb n="c57-0013__main__10"/> she sobbed audibly – He <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2615"/>the<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2615"/> then pronounced <lb n="c57-0013__main__11"/> a few sounds and the poor creature leaving <lb n="c57-0013__main__12"/> her work knelt at his feet he rasied her <lb n="c57-0013__main__13"/> and smiled with such <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2625"/>grace<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2625"/> kindness &<lb n="c57-0013__main__14"/> love that I felt <del next="#c57-0013.03" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2630"/>my own hard nerves<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2630"/><lb n="c57-0013__main__15"/><del next="#c57-0013.05" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2642" xml:id="c57-0013.03"/>move and I was obliged to withdraw from<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2642"/><lb n="c57-0013__left_margin__1"/>nature they were a<del rend="overwritten" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2662"/>nature<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2662"/>mixtureof pain & pleasure; such as I had never experienced<lb n="c57-0013__main__16"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2681" xml:id="c57-0013.05"/>my the hole. Presently the young ma<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2681"/>either from<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2690"/>the<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2690"/>hunger or cold, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2696"/>orfrom<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2696"/>or warmth or food and I<lb n="c57-0013__left_margin__1"/><del rend="overwritten" sID="c57-0013__left_margin__d3e2713"/>withdrew<del eID="c57-0013__left_margin__d3e2713"/>from my stationwithdrew<lb n="c57-0013__left_margin__2"/>unable to<lb n="c57-0013__left_margin__3"/>bear<del rend="overwritten" sID="c57-0013__left_margin__d3e2736"/>these new<del eID="c57-0013__left_margin__d3e2736"/>these<lb n="c57-0013__left_margin__4"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__left_margin__d3e2747"/>emotio<del eID="c57-0013__left_margin__d3e2747"/><mdel>ns</mdel>emotions<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0013__main__17"/> Soon after this the young man returned <lb n="c57-0013__main__18"/> bearing on his sholders a <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2772"/>load<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2772"/> load of wood <lb n="c57-0013__main__19"/> the<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2777"/>r<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2777"/> girl met him at the door<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2780"/>&<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2780"/> helped <lb n="c57-0013__main__20"/> to relieve him of his burden and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2786"/>took<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2786"/><lb n="c57-0013__main__21"/> taking some of it into the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2791"/>fire<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2791"/> cottage <lb n="c57-0013__main__22"/> placed it on the fire; <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2796"/>&<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2796"/> then she and the <lb n="c57-0013__main__23"/> youth went apart into a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2807"/>nok<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2807"/>nook of the cottage <lb n="c57-0013__main__24"/> and he shewed her a large loaf and a piece <lb n="c57-0013__main__25"/> of cheese.—She seemed pleased and went <lb n="c57-0013__main__26"/> into the garden for soome roots & plants <lb n="c57-0013__main__27"/> which she placed in water and then upon <lb n="c57-0013__main__28"/> the fire–. She <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2830"/>then<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2830"/>afterwards continued her work <mdel>&</mdel><lb n="c57-0013__left_margin__1"/>whilst<lb n="c57-0013__main__29"/> the young man went into the <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0013__main__d3e2855"/>pa<del eID="c57-0013__main__d3e2855"/> garden <lb n="c57-0013__main__30"/> and appeared busily employed in digging & pul<lb n="c57-0014__main__1"/> pulling up roots– –After he had been employed <lb n="c57-0014__main__2"/> thus about <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e2872"/>hal<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e2872"/> an hour the young woman <lb n="c57-0014__main__3"/> joined him, & they returned to the cottage <lb n="c57-0014__main__4"/> together – The old man in the mean time <lb n="c57-0014__main__5"/> had been pe<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>nsive but on the approach <lb n="c57-0014__main__6"/> of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e2898"/>the others<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e2898"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>his companions he assumed a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e2913"/>pen<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e2913"/>more cheerful <lb n="c57-0014__main__7"/> air, and they sat down to eat. They quickly <lb n="c57-0014__main__8"/> finished the<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e2929"/>ir<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e2929"/> meal <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>was quickly dispatched; the young woman was <lb n="c57-0014__main__9"/> again occupied in arranging the cottage the <lb n="c57-0014__main__10"/> old man walked before the door in the <lb n="c57-0014__main__11"/> sun for a few minutes, leaning on the arm of the you<mdel>ng</mdel>th<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e2963"/>man<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e2963"/><lb n="c57-0014__main__12"/> Nothing could exceed in beauty the contrast <lb n="c57-0014__main__13"/> between these two <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e2971"/>love<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e2971"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e2974"/>excl<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e2974"/> excellent <lb n="c57-0014__main__14"/> creatures One was old, with silver hairs <lb n="c57-0014__main__15"/> and a countenance beaming with bene <lb n="c57-0014__main__16"/> volence & love; the younger was sli<mdel>m</mdel>ght<lb n="c57-0014__main__17"/> and graceful in his <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e2995"/>fu<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e2995"/> figure and <lb n="c57-0014__main__18"/> his feautures were moulded with the <lb n="c57-0014__main__19"/> finest <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e3004"/>simetry<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e3004"/>symmetry – yet his eyes & attitude <lb n="c57-0014__main__20"/> expressed the utmost sadness and despon <lb n="c57-0014__main__21"/> dencency— The old man returned to the <lb n="c57-0014__main__22"/> cottage; and the youth with tools different <lb n="c57-0014__main__23"/> from those which he had used in the morning, <lb n="c57-0014__main__24"/> directed his steps across the fields– Night <lb n="c57-0014__main__25"/> quickly shut in but to my extreme won <lb n="c57-0014__main__26"/> der I found that the cottagers had a <lb n="c57-0014__main__27"/> means of prolonging light by the use of tapers <lb n="c57-0014__main__28"/> and was pleased to find that <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e3034"/>end<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e3034"/> setting <lb n="c57-0014__main__29"/> of the sun did not put an end <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e3040"/>I had<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e3040"/> to <lb n="c57-0014__main__30"/> the pleasure I experienced in watching <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0014__main__d3e3045"/>the<del eID="c57-0014__main__d3e3045"/><lb n="c57-0015__main__1"/> my human neighbours.–In the evening <lb n="c57-0015__main__2"/> the young girl and her companion <lb n="c57-0015__main__3"/> were employed in various occupations; <lb n="c57-0015__main__4"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3070"/>that<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3070"/>which I did not then understand, & the <lb n="c57-0015__main__5"/> old man again took that instru <lb n="c57-0015__main__6"/> ment which produced th<mdel>o</mdel>e<mdel>se</mdel> divine <lb n="c57-0015__main__7"/> sounds that had enchanted me in <lb n="c57-0015__main__8"/> the morning. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3100"/>and<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3100"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3103"/><mdel>w</mdel>When<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3103"/>So soon as he had finish <lb n="c57-0015__main__9"/> -ed the youth began,– not to play,– but <lb n="c57-0015__main__10"/><mdel>he</mdel>to utter<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3132"/>ed<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3132"/> sounds which were monoto <lb n="c57-0015__main__11"/> nous <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3138"/>and<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3138"/> and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3143"/>far from<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3143"/>neither resembling the harmony <lb n="c57-0015__main__12"/> of the old mans instrument or the <lb n="c57-0015__main__13"/> songs of the birds I since found that <lb n="c57-0015__main__14"/> he read aloud, but at that time I knew nothing of the <lb n="c57-0015__main__15"/> science of words or letters. a<mdel/>t that <lb n="c57-0015__main__16"/> time<del rend="unmarked" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3186"/>.<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3186"/> The family soon extinguished <lb n="c57-0015__main__17"/> their lights and retired, as I conjectured, <lb n="c57-0015__main__18"/> to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0015__main__d3e3193"/>sleep<del eID="c57-0015__main__d3e3193"/>. rest
